How to get movie titles from array data using JSONPATH? Data are {"movies": [{"title": "Toy Story", "year": 1995, "budget": 30000000, actors: ["Jim Varney", "Tim Allen", "Tom Hanks", "Don Rickles"]}, {"title": "Terminator 2", "year": 1999, "budget": 40000000, actors: ["Arnold Schwarzenegger", "Linda Hamilton", "Edward Furlong", "Robert Patrick"]}]}

Which JSON path to use to get an array of actor names for each movie in next array of movies? {"movies[size up to 6]": [{"title": "Toy Story", "year": 1995, "budget": 30000000, actors: ["Jim Varney", "Tim Allen", "Tom Hanks", "Don Rickles"]}, {"title": "Terminator 2", "year": 1999, "budget": 40000000, actors: ["Arnold Schwarzenegger", "Linda Hamilton", "Edward Furlong", "Robert Patrick"]}]}

How to get movies budget info from movies JSON data? Input Data: {"movies[size up to 6]": [{"title": "Toy Story", "year": 1995, "budget": 30000000, actors: ["Jim Varney", "Tim Allen", "Tom Hanks", "Don Rickles"]}, {"title": "Terminator 2", "year": 1999, "budget": 40000000, actors: ["Arnold Schwarzenegger", "Linda Hamilton", "Edward Furlong", "Robert Patrick"]}]}
How to extract nested fields from json data using JSONPath?
answer: Use dot notation for nesting fields in JSONPath. For example, to get the `name` field in `cluster` object, use the following JSONPath: `$.cluster.name`. To get the `name` field in `status` object nested in `nodes` array, use the following JSONPath: $.nodes[*].status.name
